Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2011 07:29PM - edited Aug 8, 2011 07:31PM by apaige Same here...found my lump on 5/13..PCP visit 5/25, Surgeons office, mammo and us on 6/13, Surgeons office on 7/12 follow up on 7/22 and now finally surgery scheduled for 8/22...still no real def. answers, won't find them out until after surgery...Good luck and hugs to you...
Posts.Title: Would you wait 2-3 weeks for a biopsy? Beanpole DocBabs

Posts.Content: apaige wrote: Can anyone share their experiences with this?  I am scheduled for 8/22, and I'd love to know what I am facing.  Although, my surgeon did shed a little light on this subject.  It seems as if it was all a blur.  I mean I know the basics, it's a twillight sleep, a few stitches, wear a sports bra, 1-2 weeks off of work, the pain is minimal...but really is the pain minimal?  What about the whole healing process, what about my ability to work?...and so on!  Thank you, Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: excisional breast biopsy apaige apaige

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2011 07:14PM apaige wrote: Thank you all for your input...this has put my mind at ease some!  I will keep you all posted! :)
Posts.Title: excisional breast biopsy apaige apaige

Posts.Content: apaige wrote: breast surgery, an earthquake, and a hurricane, But I don't think I will survive this wait any longer.  "One more day", that's what I keep telling myself, but easier said then done.  I will find out the results from my excisional biopsy tomorrow.  I totally freaked and panicked yesterday when I saw that the Breast Care center called my cell...thought for sure they were calling me with horrible news.  I hesitantly answered the phone with so much anxiety (knowing that they would only call me on a Sunday with bad news) to learn that it was a pre-recorded message telling me that they were confirming my Tuesday appointment.  Ughhhh.... Posts.Content: apaige wrote: So it wasn't so bad. I was pretty much in and out my experience there was a positive one. Just wait ing on results. Surgeon still seems very confident that this is a b9 mass. She did say that they took the 3 cm mass out along with scar tissue and a spot behind the scar tissue. I just can't wrap my finger around all of this stuff that decided to invade my breast. Positive thoughts to all of you! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy performed today apaige apaige

Posts.Content: apaige wrote: I accidentally found this website by doing a searchon google. Because pf my own cancer scare that happened from may13- august 26. Which is when I finally had surgery, to find that my lump was B9. I know that I am on the wrong site, but I thought that I could start here. My mother is in the very beginning stages of being diagnosed with lung cancer, and I would like to find out some information on this topic. I would also like to know how to cope as a family member of so ething so horrible. We are only 6 days in and already my sister is comparing what she is doing versus what I am doing for my mom, I work 4 days a week and my sister works 2. We both have families of our own too. I am in desperate need of some help and direction. Thank you, Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Short version apaige Megadotz

Posts.Content: apaige wrote: and I am happy to report that I have received the all clear...Total B9.  Stitches were not removed today, as the doctor feels that the incision has not totally closed up yet.  So one more visit next week to have them removed, and then I am free for 6 months.  I will continue to say prayers for each and everyone of you! Aprill Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My lab results are in apaige Lavender250

Posts.Content: apaige wrote: Had my appointment today at 2:30, the wait was god awful!  No biopsy today, will get a final biopsy on Friday, July 22nd.  But the doctor doesn't seem too worried.  She feels that it is a fluid filled cyst, and it has shrunk in size since my mammo.  If by the 22nd it hasn't gotten any smaller she will do an MRI, but she doesn't seem at all concerned of any malignancy!  I will continue to pray for all of you ladies on here, and I promise to stop back again!  Continued prayers and B9 vibes coming to all of you! Posts.Title: B9 for me apaige lisa645

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2011 09:16PM - edited Jul 8, 2011 09:17PM by apaige Thank you for your welcome greeting!!! The amount of time that has passed is killing me!!! I go on Tuesday to the bc center and will find out more!!
Posts.Title: 38 Years Old with a mammo scare apaige Madismommy719

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2011 01:09PM apaige wrote: I just say ask, ask, and ask...My ordeal started in May, May 13th to be exact.  I waited about a week, since I was due for my period, and sure enough it was still there after.  My lump seemed rather large to me, with a defined border.  PCP first said Fibroadenoma.  Went for a mammo two weeks later and a diagnostic ultrasound.  Was told by radiologist that is was a "mass" 4  months later, and the thing is finally removed.  I now have to wait for the path report, which should come some time next week.  The wait is the worst part EVER!  If  you have a chance to not wait, don't.  Ask questions now, and get answers now.  I swear I think I just aged about 10 years in the past 4 months.  Good luck!
Posts.Title: What is that? ANewSong SarahsMom

Posts.Content: apaige wrote: Found a lump on 5/13, went to the doctor on 5/17 or so.  Was told by doctor that it could be a Fibroadenoma, but to get a diagnostic mammo, and ultrasound.  I did both on 6/13 or so, and was told that they found a "suspicious abnormality".  This I already know.   The radiologist came in and said that she was 98% sure that the mass was B9.  When I got the report it said that there was a 11.2% risk of Malignancy....I have since scheduled an appointment with a breast care center and I will be going there this week.  My question is this, I have many side effects that mimic those of breast cancer:  hot spot where lump is, it's red, peeling, discharge, a little discoloration (looks like a bruise) and now, a sore appeared where the lump is also....this wait is killing me.  Has anyone else experience these symptoms with just a cyst, or with BC? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 38 Years Old with a mammo scare apaige Madismommy719

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2011 06:21PM apaige wrote: I will continue with the prayers for you!  I too had my visit today, and was basically told that it is a B9 cyst that has shrunk in size since my mammo and first ultrasound.  I did have some discharge, which is why she thinks it has shrunk in size.  Good luck, and I will check on you often!! Fingers are still crossed for you!
Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy jhunnicutt36 jhunnicutt36

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2011 08:43AM apaige wrote: Hello, Just wanted to say that this is the same situation with me right now.  Except, I really haven't been cleared of my left lump yet, and the surgeon found something in the right breast now.  I just wanted to say that I found my left lump on 5/13, got into my PCP shortly after that, but didn't get in for my diagnostic mammo and ultrasound for 2 weeks.  I was surprised by that as well.  Do you know if this ultrasound will have to be a diagnostic one?  If so, that means that you have to have a doctor present to read the results to you...so that may be what you are waiting on.  Although, I still feel that 2 weeks is entirely too long to wait, this is the reason that I was given.  As I mentioned, I found my lump on 5/13 and I still do not have any clear answers, and it's 8/6.  I think it is painfully ridiculous that they have anyone in our situation wait more than 2 weeks for anything.  Fingers crossed for you!
Posts.Title: New lump, here we go again Lavender250 Linda-n3
